#Where is the "true" part of % Max Health Damage?! Could it be? Does this champion have no True Damage?!

http://media.tumblr.com/6a189d8f0330297398e1897c5063a8cb/tumblr_inline_mqpdeeobOk1qz4rgp.gif
No, she just has two forms of %health damage. You know, can't have an ADC anymore without %Health damage!

one is a %Current health and only scales 1.25% at a time when scaling. Her other is 5% max. not even as much as vayne passive and hers is on a ~10 second E whiles Vayne's is every 3 hits.

instead of toxic its all that makes her viable since she barely breaks a .3 AD ratio on literally ANY ability.
You're suggesting a champion needs two forms of %health damage to be viable?

Not quite even if that is close to it. What im saying is that they gave her 2 forms of % health damage, and then gave her low scaling in order to prevent her from being powerful, which then resulted in the % health being necessary to be viable more so than something that was tacked onto a kit to push her further into OP.

you can either have % health for damage, or a mix of High base stats and ratios for damage. like Caitlyn VS Vayne. vayne gets off on her BoTRK synergy and W passive. Caits hammers you with Q, a handful of basics and an R.

so essentially, im saying in spite of having 2 forms of % health, she's still well within the realm of balanced due to having poor scaling.

she's more {{champion:67}}  than {{champion:51}}  but has a less selfish kit and more ephemeral design.

While I kind of agree on the 3-hit thing, I don't get the dash thing. Dash is such a broad term that can be used in many different ways. About half the champions in the game have a dash, why complain about it. I mean, there is a Summoner Spell that makes you teleport. That's like saying "Oh, another ranged champion." Otherwise, the champion is pretty unique. Her passive is unique and so is her W, which I think is where her strength will shine through along with her ultimate with her Q and E supporting this play style.

Oh look another uninspired board post complaining about a new champion before they've ever even been played.

**SO ORIGINAL.**

I'm still waiting for the day that people realize you can do this with literally any champion in the game barring some outliers (Bard, Tahm Kench) and make almost anyone's kit sound boring and uninspired. You can't take a kit apart and say "well all these component parts look similar to other component parts, so this champion is boring!" What makes a champion fun, unique, interesting, or strong is how these things all interact to create a gameplay pattern. I feel like with Kindred's passive and focus on actually effecting the game to scale over just rushing items is an interesting play pattern, and not something we've seen implemented this way before. The interactions between the spells are interesting too. 

Just for reference:
{{champion:103}} {{champion:161}} oh, just another character with skillshots that does true damage. Yawn.
{{champion:53}} {{champion:412}} sigh, more characters with hook skillshots? It's like Riot isn't even trying.
{{champion:45}} {{champion:1}} Yawn, more burst mages with targeted nukes. They're like, the same character!

You can say those things (very easily) and not be wrong, but anyone who has actually played the game knows that while the characters listed share many similarities, their gameplay style is decidedly different and their utility to a team is a different as well. Just because some guy on GD can make it seem boring doesn't mean it is.
